intro: Solenotus virgatus, commonly known as the slender solenotus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The small white or pink flowers are clustered in racemes and are followed by small, berry-like fruits.
